actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 15, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cardenas moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House resumed with Special Order speeches.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Jimmy Gomez. Mr. Gomez submitted his resignation from the Committee on Oversight and Accountability. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of the victims of the recent shooting in Kansas City, Missouri.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of the Marines who recently lost their lives in a military helicopter crash in California.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 389
actions-list.actionItem: 32 (Roll no. 49).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3202 — "To prohibit any official action to recognize or normalize relations with any Government of Syria that is led by Bashar al-Assad, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by recorded vote: 195
actions-list.actionItem: 225 (Roll no. 48).

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213
actions-list.actionItem: 209 (Roll no. 47).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 994 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7160) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the limitation on the amount certain married individuals can deduct for State and local taxes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 987) denouncing the harmful, anti-American energy policies of the Biden administration, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212
actions-list.actionItem: 208 (Roll no. 46).

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 212
actions-list.actionItem: 206 (Roll no. 45).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1009 — "Providing consideration of the bill (H.R. 7176) to repeal restrictions on the export and import of natural gas."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 418
actions-list.actionItem: 0, 1 Present (Roll no. 44).

The Chair announced the unfinished business was on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 994 and on H. Res. 1009, on agreeing to the resolutions, if ordered, and on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 3202, as amended, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 966.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Self moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 966 — "Condemning rape and sexual violence committed by Hamas in its war against Israel."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5375.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Self moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5375 — "To require a strategy for bolstering engagement and cooperation between the United States, Australia, India, and Japan and to seek to establish a Quad Intra-Parliamentary Working Group to facilitate closer cooperation on shared interests and values."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1009, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1009.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1009 — "Providing consideration of the bill (H.R. 7176) to repeal restrictions on the export and import of natural gas."

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 994, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Leger Fernandez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 994.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 994 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7160) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the limitation on the amount certain married individuals can deduct for State and local taxes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 987) denouncing the harmful, anti-American energy policies of the Biden administration, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Courtney to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Marjorie Taylor Greene to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
